intro: Sanicula javanica, commonly known as Java snakeroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, branching stems and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Sanicula javanica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
